thread.title: ET:QW Retail Handles (to add as friends)

post.body:

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
FYI, you can invite people too. So if someone hasn't updated yet (I haven't run QW today) you can invite them.

What about clan? I put in [D3W].

post.author: Phobos
post.body:
Haha sounds great.

I vote friar as the happy leader

post.author: Kristus
post.body:
Kamikazee wrote:
Kamikazeh

There you have your 'surprise'. Someone took my nick to play for about 60 seconds, now 5 days ago. (At least according to the splatterladder profile for Kamikazee.)



Well, the stats doesn't record when you're playing offline. That person might just do what I'm doing, play the campains to learn the game better before I go out on the world scene to "prove my worth". :p

As for clan, me and my friends already have this little clan called "High Society". We're not really serious about it, it's just something we use when we play together (usually all of us sitting in my livingroom). And so far, we've mainly been playing Skulltag. But we're gonna be playing ETQW now too. :D

So that's why I never got a response to my invite.

Mordenkainen

post.author: Phobos
post.body:
Well I just got done with a good few hours with Dinky.

My do you know how to TK

post.author: Dinky
post.body:
Phobos wrote:
Well I just got done with a good few hours with Dinky.

My do you know how to TK


HEY! I only got most tks ONE round! Besides, I can't help it if people get in the way of my excellence!

I think I played two campaigns and I got most kills on every round except one. (Most kills, not most TKs .) I've been able to get some serious speed in the game; I usually find myself moving so fast I confuse it with Q3 .

You were a good technician for spawn hosts! But I was saying "I need Stroyent" over and over again right in front of you and you ignored me :'(. Well, that only happened twice, but some other technician came to my rescue .

GGs.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
BNA! wrote:
I thought we already agreed on [D3W] as a tag during demo days


i don't remember.

I started a [D3W] clan. i found i can also transfer it over to you once you're on my list.

to dinky: you joined a campaign I was on & then left. What happened? That island battle turned from 4v4 to 10v10 real quick. very exciting!

handle: rich_is_bored

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
can't send a clan invite until you're on a friends list.

I wish SD made it so you could link the stats site user name with a game name so you could add friends from there. You think they could of seen the pain nintendo made the wii/ds by making you know the person ahead of time

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
goliathvt wrote:
I'm GreasedScotsman.


hehe... my first thought if reading that was Willy from "The Simpsons" telling the lunch lady to rub grease all over him.

post.author: Phobos
post.body: I'd like to take this chance to say that despite receiving another chance at redemption, Dinky continued to earn the "Most TKs" award

post.author: Dinky
post.body:
Phobos wrote:
I'd like to take this chance to say that despite receiving another chance at redemption, Dinky continued to earn the "Most TKs" award


Dude! It only happened one time the whole campaign I played with you, and I didn't get it again that night!

You should have stayed on a little later. In the next campaign I played a little Field Ops, and I tore it up! I got 48 kills in one round, yet again earning most kills.

Screenshot (It's slow because it's .png I think, I don't know if XFire can take jpeg screenshots.)

I just used a combination of Air-strikes and the Artillery Gun. Of course I just made sure that my marked location is one that will be populated by the time the rounds get there, it's pretty amazing the amount of damage you can do. On each Air-Strike and Artillery barrage I filled the entire obituary list with kills (NO team kills either! HAH!).

You over-exaggerate Phobos!! You're just jealous of my super ownage skills of being constantly awarded with Most Kills!!!!

EDIT: Oh and excuse my curse-word in the screenshot... I was quite excited . That's my so-far personal record of most kills. I bet I can top that, and I'm sure others have, but I did the best I could with a team that kind of got ran over really quick (most of them were new I think).

post.author: ensiform
post.body:
I only got invite from a person, not clan invite.

BTW why use xfire to take ss anyway. PB and in-game take them just fine and its not a hack to do it either.

post.author: Dinky
post.body:
ensiform wrote:
I only got invite from a person, not clan invite.

BTW why use xfire to take ss anyway. PB and in-game take them just fine and its not a hack to do it either.


Yeah I don't ever use Xfire. I just used it this time because I want to start trying out the XFire screenshot uploader.

Usually, I use FRAPs for screenshots, or just hit print screen and use a program to create the screenshot ('course you can only do one at a time).

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
ensiform wrote:
BTW why use xfire to take ss anyway. PB and in-game take them just fine and its not a hack to do it either.


Because it automatically uploads them to the net.

post.author: bkt

post.author: obsidian
post.body:
Thought I posted this, guess not...

[Q3W]0bsidian (that's a zero for the O).

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body:
I finally got it!!!!

handle: TattooMike


It took much begging and groveling to my wife and I endured several divorce threats, but I prevailed. Why do game companies release games that you've been waiting 3+ years for within 3 months before x-mas? If you have children it's almost impossible to buy anything for yourself at that this of year, the kids' christmas comes first.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
CrimsonHead wrote:
It took much begging and groveling to my wife and I endured several divorce threats, but I prevailed.


wow... who made the threats, you or her?

obsidian wrote:
Thought I posted this, guess not...

[Q3W]0bsidian (that's a zero for the O).


is [Q3W] a clan tag? We don't need to know that.

CrimsonHead wrote:
If you have children it's almost impossible to buy anything for yourself at that this of year, the kids' christmas comes first.


that's why I started paying a few $$ a month once pre-orders were started.

post.author: obsidian
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
is [Q3W] a clan tag? We don't need to know that.


Afraid of the pwnage? <-- (That's a Q3W custom smiley, give it back!)

We're not a clan per se, it's as much of a clan as [D3W]. I guess you could say that we're "sister" clans.

I've been getting together with about 4 to 8 other Quake3World'ers and owning it up as often as possible. We actually do quite well and enjoy trash talking the Battlefield noobs into submission. I'm the only one with an actual [Q3W] tag, so most other clans we defeated have been wondering how they got smashed by a random group of players.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
obsidian wrote:
Afraid of the pwnage? <-- (That's a Q3W custom smiley, give it back!)
We're not a clan per se, it's as much of a clan as [D3W]. I guess you could say that we're "sister" clans.
I've been getting together with about 4 to 8 other Quake3World'ers and owning it up as often as possible. We actually do quite well and enjoy trash talking the Battlefield noobs into submission. I'm the only one with an actual [Q3W] tag, so most other clans we defeated have been wondering how they got smashed by a random group of players.


actually... i need to know because clan tags are separate from the name but if you put the tag in your name I'd need it to add you as a buddy.

post.body:

Just 0bsidian with a zero. I now feel like slipping into a crack somewhere.

post.author: parsonsbear
post.body:
the official [id] server is empty all the time- who would be interested in meeting up for a d3w match there (happy_friar and i tried but couldn't accumulate enough randoms for a proper game)

192.246.40.230:27733

i'm on eastern time, have a pretty open schedule these days- anyone?

post.author: Phobos
post.body:
I'm always on ranked servers with friends or doing organized scrims with EXG, and I'm still in the d3w clan registry so just let me know

I'm up for whatever.

post.author: Mordenkainen
post.body: I have around 150-200ms lag but I'll be there. Which times?

post.author: Dinky
post.body:
It hasn't always been empty. I played in that server before and it was full up. That was a while ago though, and I haven't played in it or seen it full of people since.

I'm on EST too. Times please? Weekends are the only free time I have anymore really.

post.author: parsonsbear

post.body: I'll get on right now, see if you guys are on the server. I missed the 5 o'clock cue because I was at the gym =/.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body: i'm eating dinner now. Most likely will be back ~6:45est.

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body: Hey, I got your invite, I was ingame and did'nt get get it for an hour and a half after you sent it, I went looking for you but I guess I just missed you. You want to set up another D3W game day Like Fri. or Sat.? I get off work at about 8pm central Fri.

post.author: Sebultura
post.body: Same thing here as Mordenkainen: I tried the server and I've got around 200 ping whereas I was alone on the map

post.author: breakerfall
post.body: My handle is breakerfall, but I won't have access to my desktop computer again until I get home after the new year. I love the game so far (even more so because I don't get in-game advertising with the linux client!!) so I look forward to playing some games soon. I'm a UK player, by the way.

post.author: Phobos
post.body: I'd like to take this chance to say that despite receiving another chance at redemption, Dinky continued to earn the "Most TKs" award

post.author: Dinky
post.body:
Phobos wrote:
I'd like to take this chance to say that despite receiving another chance at redemption, Dinky continued to earn the "Most TKs" award


Dude! It only happened one time the whole campaign I played with you, and I didn't get it again that night!

You should have stayed on a little later. In the next campaign I played a little Field Ops, and I tore it up! I got 48 kills in one round, yet again earning most kills.

Screenshot (It's slow because it's .png I think, I don't know if XFire can take jpeg screenshots.)

I just used a combination of Air-strikes and the Artillery Gun. Of course I just made sure that my marked location is one that will be populated by the time the rounds get there, it's pretty amazing the amount of damage you can do. On each Air-Strike and Artillery barrage I filled the entire obituary list with kills (NO team kills either! HAH!).

You over-exaggerate Phobos!! You're just jealous of my super ownage skills of being constantly awarded with Most Kills!!!!

EDIT: Oh and excuse my curse-word in the screenshot... I was quite excited . That's my so-far personal record of most kills. I bet I can top that, and I'm sure others have, but I did the best I could with a team that kind of got ran over really quick (most of them were new I think).

post.author: ensiform

post.author: Dinky
post.body:
ensiform wrote:
I only got invite from a person, not clan invite.

BTW why use xfire to take ss anyway. PB and in-game take them just fine and its not a hack to do it either.


Yeah I don't ever use Xfire. I just used it this time because I want to start trying out the XFire screenshot uploader.

Usually, I use FRAPs for screenshots, or just hit print screen and use a program to create the screenshot ('course you can only do one at a time).

Because it automatically uploads them to the net.

post.author: obsidian
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
is [Q3W] a clan tag? We don't need to know that.


Afraid of the pwnage? <-- (That's a Q3W custom smiley, give it back!)

We're not a clan per se, it's as much of a clan as [D3W]. I guess you could say that we're "sister" clans.

I've been getting together with about 4 to 8 other Quake3World'ers and owning it up as often as possible. We actually do quite well and enjoy trash talking the Battlefield noobs into submission. I'm the only one with an actual [Q3W] tag, so most other clans we defeated have been wondering how they got smashed by a random group of players.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
obsidian wrote:
Afraid of the pwnage? <-- (That's a Q3W custom smiley, give it back!)
We're not a clan per se, it's as much of a clan as [D3W]. I guess you could say that we're "sister" clans.
I've been getting together with about 4 to 8 other Quake3World'ers and owning it up as often as possible. We actually do quite well and enjoy trash talking the Battlefield noobs into submission. I'm the only one with an actual [Q3W] tag, so most other clans we defeated have been wondering how they got smashed by a random group of players.

GGs.

post.author: obsidian
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
is [Q3W] a clan tag? We don't need to know that.


Afraid of the pwnage? <-- (That's a Q3W custom smiley, give it back!)

We're not a clan per se, it's as much of a clan as [D3W]. I guess you could say that we're "sister" clans.

I've been getting together with about 4 to 8 other Quake3World'ers and owning it up as often as possible. We actually do quite well and enjoy trash talking the Battlefield noobs into submission. I'm the only one with an actual [Q3W] tag, so most other clans we defeated have been wondering how they got smashed by a random group of players.

post.body:

I'm the only one with an actual [Q3W] tag, so most other clans we defeated have been wondering how they got smashed by a random group of players.
